diagnosis.tumorSize: 3.5 cm, involving clivus and extending towards sphenoid sinus, abutting brainstem.
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Biopsy only. Deemed unresectable due to brainstem proximity.

treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Intensity-Modulated Proton Therapy (IMPT) / Pencil Beam Scanning

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in custom thermoplastic mask. Bite block used for reproducibility. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Mask marks aligned to room lasers for daily setup.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: High-resolution CT acquired in thermoplastic mask. Fused with diagnostic MRI for proton planning.

dosimetry.constraints: Brainstem Max < 54 Gy(RBE); Chiasm Max < 54 Gy(RBE); Optic Nrv Max < 54 Gy(RBE)
dosimetry.planNotes: High dose proton therapy for chordoma utilizing pencil beam scanning to achieve sharp dose fall-off away from critical structures.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily orthogonal x-rays matched to bony anatomy. Setup stable.
fractions.notes: No significant neurological changes. Tolerating well.

imagingAndReports.summary: 3.5 cm enhancing mass centered in the clivus, characteristic of chordoma.

reportDetails.findings: There is a large, lobulated, T2 hyperintense mass centered within the clivus, measuring 3.5 x 3.0 x 3.2 cm. The mass demonstrates heterogeneous enhancement following contrast administration. It extends anteriorly into the posterior aspect of the sphenoid sinus and posteriorly causes mass effect upon the ventral pons, without clear invasion. The cavernous sinuses appear clear. The optic nerves and chiasm are uninvolved.
reportDetails.impression: Large clival mass with imaging characteristics highly suggestive of chordoma. Significant mass effect on the brainstem.

reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Sections show fragments of tumor composed of cords and lobules of cells set within an abundant myxoid stroma. Characteristic physaliphorous cells with bubbly cytoplasm are identified. Immunohistochemical stains show strong nuclear positivity for Brachyury and positivity for Cytokeratin AE1/AE3 and EMA. S100 is also positive.
reportDetails.comment: Findings are diagnostic of conventional chordoma.

imagingAndReports.summary: No evidence of distant metastatic disease.

reportDetails.findings: Lungs are clear. No suspicious hepatic or adrenal lesions. No retroperitoneal or pelvic adenopathy. Osseous structures unremarkable.
reportDetails.impression: No evidence of distant metastatic disease.

imagingAndReports.summary: High-resolution CT acquired in thermoplastic mask. Fused with diagnostic MRI for proton planning.

reportDetails.procedure: CT simulation for proton therapy of skull base.
reportDetails.setup: Patient positioned supine in custom thermoplastic mask with headrest for immobilization.
reportDetails.scanParams: High-resolution non-contrast CT scan acquired from vertex through C3 with 1.0 mm slice thickness.
reportDetails.fusion: Diagnostic MRI Brain/Skull Base (01/05/2025) fused with simulation CT dataset for precise target volume delineation.
reportDetails.notes: Patient tolerated procedure well. Setup reproducible. Data sent for IMPT planning.

labResults.notes: Baseline pituitary function check due to tumor location

progressNotes.author: Dr. Helen Merlin (Neuro-Onc)
progressNotes.summary: 49yo M with HA, diplopia. MRI shows clival mass c/w chordoma. Referred to Neurosurgery for biopsy, Rad Onc for definitive tx discussion as likely unresectable.

progressNotes.author: ENT/NeuroSx Team
progressNotes.summary: Endoscopic endonasal biopsy of clival mass performed. Path confirmed Chordoma.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert Evans (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ unresectable clival chordoma. Discussed definitive high-dose RT. Strong recommendation for proton therapy (IMPT) due to critical location near brainstem/optic structures to maximize dose conformality and minimize toxicity. Plan for 74 Gy(RBE)/37fx. Risks/benefits, potential side effects (mucositis, fatigue, late CNS/optic toxicity) discussed. Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Physics/Dosimetry
progressNotes.summary: IMPT plan using pencil beam scanning finalized. Excellent target coverage with significant sparing of brainstem, optic chiasm, temporal lobes compared to potential photon plans. Plan approved by Dr. Evans.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert Evans (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 10/37 fx. Reports mild fatigue, some nasal congestion/dryness. No significant neurological changes. Tolerating well. Daily IGRT confirms accurate setup. Continue RT.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Definitive (curative) high-dose radiation therapy for an unresectable skull base chordoma.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Fatigue, mucositis (mouth/throat sores), taste changes, skin reaction, potential for headache or worsening neurologic symptoms. Late: Risk of damage to nearby critical structures like brainstem, optic nerves/chiasm, pituitary gland (hormone issues), and temporal lobes (memory). Explained that proton therapy is used specifically to minimize these late risks.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Reporting any new or worsening vision changes, headaches, weakness, or numbness immediately. Importance of nutritional support if swallowing becomes difficult.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, report symptoms, manage side effects with supportive medications.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use supportive medications (anti-nausea, artificial tears, pain meds) as needed.
